name: Hotel Amira Istanbul

reviews.text: Staff were wonderful room was fantastic loved the decor. Amira was so close to main sights and so so many good shops in the street. Enjoyed sunset on the roof top after their delightful afternoon tea. Breakfast. Was excellent.
reviews.title: A pleasure to be their guest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After the cruise I stayed here behind for one more day in Istanbul with my wife. Well, this hotel has a very good location, only within ten minutes by walking to all major scenery. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. They even help us to book a high quality with very beautiful sunset view but not expensive Mostra Sea Food restaurant just behind this hotel. We enjoy very very much that evening.
reviews.title: A pleasant stay.

reviews.text: My wife and I and some friends recently stayed at the Amira for 5 nights. The service we received from the day we arrived until the day we left was nothing less than exceptional. The day we arrived a member of staff spent probably an hour with us on the hotel’s roof terrace telling us about the hotel’s amenities, must places to visit in Istanbul, local restaurants and where not to shop, i.e. the Grand Bazaar. Visit it, yes, but make your purchases elsewhere! None of this I’m sure with an ulterior motive. The service we received from all members of the hotel staff for the remainder of our stay was equally exemplary.
reviews.title: A small hotel big on service

reviews.text: We had a standard room, which although not huge, was comfortable enough for two people. The bed was particularly comfortable. Coffee and tea making facilities were available in the room as was a mini bar. Fresh bottled water was provided daily. The bathroom, although on the small size, had everything we needed. The shower was excellent and hot water was always available.
reviews.title: A night in the Old City

reviews.text: We ate breakfast in the hotel every day. The quality of the food and variety available was excellent, if slightly tilted towards what I assume is Turkish tastes. We usually ate breakfast around 9am and at that time it was sometimes difficult to find a table to sit all of us. After 9:30 the restaurant emptied. We were never there before 9am!
reviews.title: What an amazing place...

reviews.text: Stayed here Oct 4th, 5th, 6th, 2013. Decided on the "Cultural Package" because it included shuttle service from the airport as well as to our ship the Regent Seven Seas Mariner on the 7th
reviews.title: 3 nights before cruise
Very nice family hotel
reviews.text: as well as one 1/2 day tour.

reviews.title: The perfect place to stay!
reviews.text: Wonderful, very clean, 30 room hotel located within walking distance of all the places tourist want to see in the old part of Istanbul. Arthur, (AJ), and the rest of the staff were fantastic. Very friendly and helpful with any question we might have. Made reservations for us at two nice restaurants close by. Included breakfast buffet has many things to choose from. Really neat roof top lounge area. Would stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone going to Istanbul.

This July we visit Turkey, with the occasion of a friend getting married. The hotel perfect, next to the sea in a good part of the city. Breakfast is served until 11.00. Worth the money, cake, eggs, nice bread, pita, fruit, joghurts and good coffee. Room very clean and smelling fresh. Cleaning ladies very friendly. The city is very organized and touristic a hidden gem. Make cruise at instanbul to see places around. People here have good life, spend time to have coffee and tea and discuss and socialize. Also, the food in the hotel is surprise. Eat at the restaurant. The terrace is a place with nice weather and view to the sea. Wine selection and chess selection in international standards. I think the hotel has to sell some of its products. Cosmetics was at a great standard, my wife agrees with that. We would buy if there is availability. I think that the reviews until now say truth for the hotel. It is position 2 and it deserve it. There are early booking discounts as well, if we book again we opt for better price.
reviews.title: Look no further

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed with 2 friends and we all loved it! We had a family room which was two rooms with a 'private' entrance which was better value than two rooms. Liked the decor - modern Turkish - some quirky touches too. Rooftop is gorgeous. Breakfast was good and afternoon tea was a nice touch. We hired the spa for two hours, it was lovely and spotless. As everyone says it is the staff who make it wonderful, they are helpful efficient and friendly - they want you to have a great time and to come back next time. I will go back!
reviews.title: Great Location; Wonderful STaff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Amira for 3 nights before our cruise. Then, we left our luggage in storage there after the cruise while we traveled to Cappadocia for a few nights. We returned to the Hotel Amira for 2 nights before we left for home. It was our first trip to Istanbul and this hotel was highly recommended by friends who had stayed there in the past. It did not disappoint. The rooms are large, soundproof, and clean. The bed was very comfortable with fine linens. The bathroom was modern and well appointed with large, thick towels and other amenities such as fluffy bathrobes and slippers. There was a bottle of water, coffee and tea service with an electric kettle. There was a mini-bar which we did not use. The price of the hotel includes breakfast, afternoon tea and wifi. There is a rooftop lounge with bar service and fantastic views of the Sea of Marmara and the ships lined up to enter the Bosphorus. The location is very close to the attractions, 5-10 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia.
reviews.title: At Home in a Foreign Land

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We cannot praise the staff of this hotel enough. Our bags were whisked away and we found them when we went to our room. We were welcomed by the Concierge and given an Orientation to the hotel and to Istanbul. We were offered tea, coffee, snacks upon arrival. We felt at home immediately. Breakfast was delicious and guests gathered and socialized in the spacious downstairs room and discuss their travel plans. Likewise, cocktails on the rooftop, or when it was too windy, in the downstairs room, were very pleasant and enjoyable. We found friendly service from the hotel staff who were there to serve you! Service was provided with a smile and nothing was too much effort. We truly felt at home at the Amira! We would highly recommend it to friends and family!
reviews.title: "highly recommended hotel in the old town"

reviews.text: Came by chance (volcanic eruption) to an overnight stay in Istanbul, this hotel was welcoming at first glance. Courteous and polite owners and staff. Spotlessly clean rooms, beautiful bathroom, tasty breakfast buffet, not cheap but worth the price. Will definitely be back
reviews.title: Fantastic location, fantastic service

reviews.text: Just back from 5 days in Istanbul with my family. Hotel Amira is perfectly placed to explore the main sights-5 mins walk from Hagia and Blue Mosque; 10 mins to Cisterns and Palace and 15 mins to Grand Bazaar. Some very nice shops and small bazaar within 5 mins walk.
reviews.title: Fantastic- beautiful staff, view and location

reviews.text: Service great and charming as other reviewers have stated. Wifi connections better than at home!
reviews.title: "It was more than we expected"
Best Hotel in a Wonderful City
reviews.text: I would echo the comments made about this hotel- the location is ideal and the staff are the best we have encountered in all our years of travel. Special thanks to Tina and Ugur for their outstanding service. We had a marvelous six night stay and when we return there is no doubt the Amira Hotel will once again be our first choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have now stayed at Hotel Amira in 2012 and in 2013, as well as other hotels in the city, which has provided some basis for comparison. Without any doubt this hotel is my first choice for all the reasons that have been discussed in the many reviews. The standard rooms are smallish but that is typical for any hotel at this pricepoint. I like the location and the proximity to the sites as well as the taxi stand right outside the door. What puts this hotel into a five star category however, is its amazing staff. Thanks to all who made my two recent visits to Istanbul so enjoyable. I will return.
reviews.title: My Favourite in Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could be a great hotel, but unfortunately it is not perfect.
reviews.title: Could be a great hotel, but ...
Perfect Hotel lives up to its Reviews
reviews.text: Very nice, friendly and helpful reception staff, really, but sometimes sloppy housekeeping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful location, but the old leaky windows and noise from the outside.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

description: Hotel Amira Istanbul offers you the most spacious design rooms in the old city , with very comfortable visco mattresses, high-tech amenities like i-pod docking stations and local touches like hand-made ceiling paintings .These rooms are tailor made for your contentment .
